colour.corresponding.dataset.corresponding_chromaticities Module¶

Breneman Corresponding Chromaticities Dataset¶

Defines Breneman (1987) results for corresponding chromaticities experiments.

See also

Corresponding Chromaticities Prediction Jupyter Notebook

References

[1]Breneman, E. J. (1987). Corresponding chromaticities for different states of adaptation to complex visual fields. JOSA A, 4(6). Retrieved from http://www.opticsinfobase.org/josaa/fulltext.cfm?uri=josaa-4-6-1115&id=2783
class colour.corresponding.dataset.corresponding_chromaticities.BrenemanExperimentResult[source]¶

Bases: colour.corresponding.dataset.corresponding_chromaticities.BrenemanExperimentResult

Experiment result.

Parameters:
  • name (unicode) – Test colour name.
  • uvp_t (numeric) – Chromaticity coordinates \(uv_t^p\) of test colour.
  • uvp_m (array_like, (2,)) – Chromaticity coordinates \(uv_m^p\) of matching colour.
  • s_uvp (array_like, (2,), optional) – Interobserver variation (\(x10^3\)) \(\sigma_uv^p\).
  • d_uvp_i (array_like, (2,), optional) – Deviation of individual linear transformation (\(x10^3\)) \(\delta_uv_i^p\).
  • d_uvp_g (array_like, (2,), optional) – Deviation of individual linear transformation (\(x10^3\)) \(\delta_uv_g^p\).

Returns a new instance of the BrenemanExperimentResult class.

class colour.corresponding.dataset.corresponding_chromaticities.PrimariesChromaticityCoordinates[source]¶

Bases: colour.corresponding.dataset.corresponding_chromaticities.PrimariesChromaticityCoordinates

Chromaticity coordinates of primaries.

Parameters:
  • experiment (integer) – Experiment.
  • illuminants (array_like, (2,)) – Chromaticity coordinates \(uv_t^p\) of test colour.
  • Y (numeric) – White luminance \(Y\) in \(cd/m^2\).
  • P_uvp (numeric) – Chromaticity coordinates \(uv^p\) of primary \(P\).
  • D_uvp (numeric) – Chromaticity coordinates \(uv^p\) of primary \(D\).
  • T_uvp (numeric) – Chromaticity coordinates \(uv^p\) of primary \(T\).

Returns a new instance of the BrenemanExperimentResult class.
